newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's unity under attack from Bossi.
newsitem.headline: Italy's unity under attack from Bossi.

text.p: Italy, which faces a drive for northern independence from secessionist leader Umberto Bossi, was established as single country only in 1861 and it took a further decade for unification to be completed.
Following is a brief overview of its historical foundations.
* Mid-6th century AD - Final disintegration of Roman empire.
* 9th century - Break up of Carolingian Empire sparks foundation of many rival states
* End 15th century - Florence, Milan and Venice organise themselves as powerful independent states. South and central Italy divided into Kingdom of Naples and the Roman Catholic Church's Papal States
* Mid-16th century - Spain controls Sicily, Naples, Sardinia and Milan until start of 18th century
* Early 17th century - Lombardy, Mantua, Naples, Sardinia come under Austrian control
* 1796 - France invades Italy under Napoleon. Finally gains control of peninsula by 1810
* 1815 - Peace settlement after fall of Napoleon at Waterloo gives Austria control of much of the peninsula
* 1830s-40s - Growth of national feeling against Austria in movement to reform and unite Italy known as the "risorgimento"
* Late 1850s - Count Camillo Cavour, prime minister of Piedmont, formally raises question of Italian unity
* 1859 - Austria declares war on powerful Piedmont region and France

* 1860 - Bologna, Parma, Modena, Tuscany unite with Piedmont. Irregular soldier Giuseppe Garibaldi, joined by 1,000 red-shirted volunteers, sails from Genoa to Sicily and Naples with mission to unify Italy
* 1861 - Kingdom of Italy proclaimed with Turin as capital
* 1870 - Piedmont takes Rome to complete unity of Italy.
